questions.question_text: A company is implementing a new radar system from July to September. The project manager knows these months are the peak hurricane season for this region. Which of the following should the project manager develop to mitigate the risk to the project?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
A Contingency Plan is indeed the recommended action when a project faces potential risks like hurricane season during its implementation . A contingency plan allows for proactive management and preparation for potential adverse effects of such risks, ensuring the project's ability to adapt or recover swiftly should the risks materialize.

Selected Answer: C
The next step in the process is to seek baseline approval.

The work breakdown structure (WBS) is a deliverable-oriented hierarchical decomposition of the total scope of work to be executed by the project team to accomplish the project goals and create the required deliverables.

The backlog is a list of all the work that needs to be done in order to complete the project. It is typically organized by priority and due date.

The resource pool is a list of all the resources that are available to the project team. This includes people, equipment, and materials.

Once the PM has defined tasks, durations, resources, and costs, they need to seek baseline approval from the project stakeholders. This is a formal process that ensures that everyone is on the same page and that there is a clear understanding of the project scope, schedule, budget, and risks.

Once the baseline is approved, the project can move into the execution phase.

Selected Answer: C
You've essentially created the project schedule at this point, now you just need to get it approved.

questions.question_text: As part of the planning phase, a PM has defined tasks, durations, resources, and costs. Which of the following is the NEXT step in the process?

A PM has gathered stakeholders from across various functions in the organization. The team has never worked together before. Which of the following should the PM do to ensure standards are understood?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The question is mentioning stakeholders, so it is referring to communication plans. If a Q is confusing, re-phrase it until it's more clear what it's asking.

Selected Answer: D
I literally couldn't find "team training" in the textbook, nor the Dion study guide. Communication plan is in both of them though. Defined as " a thorough plan explaining the actions you'll take to communicate information to stakeholders. It ultimately identifies your essential brand messaging, including branding basics like your value proposition, while using different types of storytelling to share information with the public. Your communication plan will help your team understand who should be getting which notifications and when to loop in project stakeholders."
Kachow. its D
the outcome of a communications plan is to ensure that standards are understood. A communications plan does not teach a team how to work together. I believe D is what the answer is.
I was first thinking D, But that makes no sense because the communication plan would have already been set in place. So Team training makes the most amount of sense.

Selected Answer: A
A - Conducting team training is important when stakeholders from various functions who have never worked together are brought together for a project. It helps ensure that everyone understands the project's standards, processes, and expectations. Training can provide a common understanding of roles, responsibilities, communication protocols, and any specific standards relevant to the project. This lays the foundation for effective collaboration and reduces the likelihood of misunderstandings or misaligned expectations among team members.

Selected Answer: C
Its a matrix org, meaning that team members are going to be reporting to the PM and the FM (No not the radio waves) Rather than just one or the other. If theyre too busy working on things for the functional manager then the PM is probably going to have to secure more time for the Project mentioned in the question

Selected Answer: C

In a matrix organizational structure, team members often report to both a functional manager and a project manager. If team members don't have enough time to dedicate to project activities, the project manager should negotiate with the functional managers to secure more of the team members' time for the project. This can involve discussing the project's priorities, deadlines, and resource needs.
